Title: Enable Revisions
DescriptionLines: **Document Revisions** are snapshots of a document that are taken over time per document change.
Once created, revisions are immutable and are useful when you need to track the changes made to the document.
Document revisions are not enabled by default.
This demo shows how to enable the feature.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define default revisions values for all collections
DescriptionLines: * Define default values for _all_ the collections in the database.
Values can be overridden per collection, as shown in the next step.
* _Disabled_ - Enable or disable the revisions feature.
* _PurgeOnDelete_ - Configure deletion of the revisions upon the parent document deletion.
* _MinimumRevisionsToKeep_ - Configure number of revisions to keep.
In this example, only the latest 5 revision will be kept.
In this example, revision will not be kept after 14 days.

Walkthroughs.Title: Define specific revisions values per collection
DescriptionLines: * Define revisions values per specific collection.
* These values will _override_ the default configuration from the previous step.

Walkthroughs.Title: Create the revisions configuration object
DescriptionLines: Assign the _'defaultConfig'_ and the _'collections'_ that were defined in the previous steps.
* The 'RevisionsConfiguration' will be used in the next step to set up the revisions configurations in the Document Store.

Walkthroughs.Title: Set the revisions configuration in the Document Store
DescriptionLines: * Create a `NewConfigureRevisionsOperation` and `Send()` it to the Document Store.
* Per collection, if 'Disabled' was set to false, then the revision feature will be enabled and a revision will be created for every document change.
